summary: Mobile e-commerce app for women’s apparel and jewelry with multi-admin management, customer registration via international mobile numbers, ordering, and payments.
architectural_notes: Admin authentication/authorization uses Internet Identity; admin access is determined by checking the signed-in principal against an admin allowlist on the backend (e.g., to access /admin).
known_issues: Admin login not working – user unable to authenticate as admin

existing_features.title: Create a mobile-first e-commerce storefront focused on women’s clothing and jewelry, including: home page, category browsing, product listing pages, product detail pages (images, price, description, variants like size/color where applicable), search, and a shopping cart.

Add customer registration and login using an international mobile phone number (country code + number) as the customer identifier, and allow customers to maintain a basic profile (name, phone, optional shipping address).
Implement an ordering and checkout flow: cart review, shipping details collection, order review, order submission, and order confirmation with an order ID; store order status in the backend.
Integrate payment processing for orders so customers can pay during checkout, and persist payment status (e.g., pending/paid/failed) on the order.
Implement admin access for 3–4 admins to log in and view/manage store details, including products and orders, via an admin-only dashboard.
Choose and apply a coherent visual theme suitable for a women’s apparel & jewelry mobile shop (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) and enforce it consistently across all screens.
Add generated brand/static images and render them in the UI from frontend static assets (not via the backend).
Update the app’s displayed name to "Neelamaa" wherever it is shown in the storefront UI, including the HTML document title and the global header/footer brand text.
Update hard-coded brand alt text to reflect the new brand name "Neelamaa" for accessibility (e.g., logo alt text and home hero banner alt text), without changing image filenames or paths.

Expose a simple UI affordance for testing/admin onboarding that lets a logged-in user trigger the new admin-onboarding API and then immediately re-check admin status (so the user can log in and become admin without manual backend edits).

Add a visible, clearly labeled "Admin Login" button to the main app interface (e.g., in the header or home page) that routes to /admin and triggers Internet Identity login if the user is not authenticated
Add a visible, clearly labeled "Login" or "Sign In" button for regular users (customers) that triggers Internet Identity login and is accessible from the main storefront interface
Investigate and fix the admin login authentication flow to ensure users can successfully authenticate as admin using Internet Identity when clicking the "Admin Login" button
Ensure the frontend AdminGuard component properly checks admin status after Internet Identity login and displays appropriate error messages if admin verification fails
Add console logging to the admin authentication flow (both frontend and backend) to help diagnose where the login process is failing

new_feature_requests.summary: Build a mobile e-commerce app focused on women’s clothing and jewelry (product browsing/catalog).
Support 3–4 admin logins to manage and view all store/customer/order details (admin panel/roles).
Enable customer registration/login using mobile number for any country (international phone support/OTP).

Implement backend data models and APIs to support products, categories, inventory/availability, carts, orders, and user profiles required by the storefront (including persistence in canister stable storage).
Add an admin onboarding mechanism to grant a specific Internet Identity principal admin access (e.g., add current user principal to admin allowlist).

Add a backend admin-onboarding API that allows the currently authenticated caller (Internet Identity principal) to become an admin in a safe, deterministic way suitable for testing (e.g., allow the first admin to be claimed when no admins exist yet), so the user who says "make me admin" can access admin-only APIs like product creation and viewing all orders.
Add a visible login button specifically for admins on the app's login or home page.
When the app is ready, add a visible login button for users (customers) to sign in.
Verify that the backend getCallerUserRole() method correctly returns admin role for authenticated principals who have been granted admin access
